hero.title: If they could speak, what would they say?
hero.subtitle: Raising awareness about animal exploitation through street activism and truth-based conversations

quoteSection.quote: Imagine being born into a world where your fate was already sealed. You were just a number — and your death, a scheduled event.

whoWeAre.title: Who we are
whoWeAre.description: We are a grassroots collective of animal rights activists. Since 2018, we've been educating the public with real footage from farms and slaughterhouses, showing the hidden cost of meat, dairy, eggs, leather, and more. In 2023, we formed Anonymous for the Unheard, a growing movement giving voice to the silenced and demanding justice for all animals.

whatWeBelieve.title: What we believe in
whatWeBelieve.description: We envision a world where animals are no longer treated as commodities, but as sentient beings worthy of respect, freedom, and peace. Through education and peaceful activism, we challenge norms and offer a better way forward for all living beings.

meat.title: Meat
meat.description: We see meat as food, not as someone's body. But every cut comes from a life that wanted to live — just like us.

fish.title: Fish
fish.description: Fish feel pain. They struggle, suffocate, and vanish by the billions — unseen, unheard.

eggs.title: Eggs
eggs.description: Eggs seem harmless. But behind every carton is a story of suffering, silenced chirps, and discarded lives.

dairy.title: Dairy
dairy.description: Most of us grew up believing dairy was normal, necessary, and natural. We were never shown the reality behind the glass of milk.

interlude.lineOne: Where did the love go? The love you once felt for all animals?
interlude.lineTwo: Who taught you to pet one and pay for another to be slaughtered?

factoryFarming.question: If factory farming is normal and humane, why does the industry go to such lengths to hide it?

cta.heading: IT STARTS WITH YOU
cta.description: Change doesn't begin in governments or big industries. It begins with a single person choosing to care — to act.
cta.quote1: It starts with what you eat.
cta.invitation: Because every compassionate choice you make tells the world:
cta.line: Animals are not ours to use

meat.title: Meat
meat.subtitle: The Price of a Meal
meat.previewDescription: We see meat as food, not as someone's body. But every cut comes from a life that wanted to live — just like us.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
content: Can you imagine watching others taken from you, one by one?
You hear screams. You smell blood. You see panic. You don't understand what's happening — but you know something is terribly wrong.
If you try to resist, you're beaten or shocked with an electric prod. You're pushed forward, step by step, toward the same fate.
This is the reality for animals used for meat — all of them. Not just pigs, cows, or sheep — all beings bred for slaughter face fear, violence, and death.
Isn't it time to question that tradition?

facts.title: Did You Know?
items: Over 70 billion land animals are killed for meat each year.
Many are just babies when they're slaughtered.
Humane slaughter still ends in a terrified death.
Pigs are as smart as dogs — and scream just as loudly.
Animals often watch their companions die before them.

fish.title: Fish
fish.subtitle: The Silent Suffocation
fish.previewDescription: Fish feel pain. They struggle, suffocate, and vanish by the billions — unseen, unheard.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
content: Can you imagine suffocating while fully conscious?
That's what trillions of fish endure every year.
Dragged from the ocean in massive nets, they're crushed, injured, and left to slowly suffocate on ship decks — still conscious, still feeling pain.
Others spend their short lives trapped in filthy, overcrowded fish farms, swimming in circles, infected and unseen.
We never hear their screams. But that doesn't mean they don't suffer.

facts.title: Did You Know?
items: Fish feel pain, just like cats or dogs.
More fish are killed each year than all other animals combined.
Most are not stunned before death — they suffocate or are cut alive.
Farmed fish live in filthy, crowded cages, filled with disease.
Fish have individual personalities and can even recognize faces.

eggs.title: Eggs
eggs.subtitle: The Cost of Eggs
eggs.previewDescription: Eggs seem harmless. But behind every carton is a story of suffering, silenced chirps, and discarded lives.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
content: Can you imagine being born into a world where your worth is measured only by what you can produce?
For hens, life begins in darkness. If you're male, you're ground up or gassed on your first day — because you can't lay eggs.
If you're female, you're confined, mutilated, and pushed to your limit until your body gives out. Your beak is cut. Your wings never spread. Your song goes unheard.
Behind every carton of eggs is a life reduced to a machine — until it breaks.

facts.title: Did You Know?
items: Male chicks are ground up alive on their first day of life.
Even free-range hens often live in overcrowded sheds.
Hens are genetically manipulated to lay far more eggs than is natural.
Their bodies often break down from overproduction.
Hens are killed when their egg production slows — long before old age.

dairy.title: Dairy
dairy.subtitle: The Mother Behind the Milk
dairy.previewDescription: Most of us grew up believing dairy was normal, necessary, and natural. We were never shown the reality behind the glass of milk.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
content: Can you imagine having your baby taken from you, again and again, just so others can drink your milk?
In dairy, cows aren't just exploited — they're mothers robbed of motherhood.
They cry for days when their calves are taken. The milk meant for their babies is taken for humans.
Their bodies are pushed to extremes with constant cycles of forced pregnancy and loss.
When they're no longer profitable, they're sent to slaughter — treated like nothing, after giving everything.

facts.title: Did You Know?
items: Cows only produce milk after giving birth, just like humans.
Calves are taken away from their mothers within hours.
Males are often killed for veal — a byproduct of dairy.
Dairy cows are repeatedly impregnated to keep milk flowing.
Most are slaughtered around age 5 — their natural lifespan is 20.

callToAction.title: What You Can Do
callToAction.description: Every compassionate choice you make tells the world: Animals are not ours to use
